term.name: OpenStudio Type
term.description: Type of OpenStudio Object

level_1.name: Electric Lighting
level_1.description: Technology categories contained in the Electric Lighting group pertain to the use of electric power to provide space illumination. Lighting sources, as well as technologies that enable the generation of, or distribute or direct electrically-generated light, are also included within this group.

level_2.name: Lamp Ballasts
level_2.description: Products found within the Lamp Ballast subgroup are used to limit current to electric lamps.

level_3.name: Lamp Ballasts
level_3.description: This technology category includes all types of electric-discharge lamp ballasts that limit current to remote lamps. Lighting ballasts that are an integral part of replacement lamps intended to replace existing lamps in existing luminaires (i.e., screw-based compact fluorescent replacement lamps) are not included. Similarly, light-emitting diode drivers are also not included. Lighting ballasts for remote fluorescent, mercury vapor, metal halide, high- and low-pressure sodium, and other non solid-state lighting lamps are included.

term.name: OpenStudio Type
term.description: Type of OpenStudio Object

term.name: Manufacturer/Brand Owner
term.description: The name of the company that manufactures the product and/or that owns the product brand.

term.name: Brand
term.description: The brand name under which the submitted product is marketed and/or sold in the U.S. In some cases, this may be identical to the name of the manufacturer/brand owner.

term.name: Product Line/Family Name
term.description: If the product being submitted is part of a family of products or models, supply the product line or family name here. As an example, if the submission were an automobile, this field would contain the model name.

term.name: Model Number
term.description:
The unique model number used by the manufacturer/brand owner to identify the specific product being submitted to the Technology Performance Exchange. Sometimes referred to as “catalog number.”
Model numbers should be entered in the same style as that used by the manufacturer/brand owner, including all applicable slashes (/) and dashes (-). If certain alphanumeric characters in the model number identify product variations that do not impact energy performance, please replace each of those alphanumeric characters with an asterisk (*) when entering the model number on this website. This convention reduces the need to submit separate forms for product variations that have identical performance data. However, if a subset, but not all options for a specific character in the model number do not affect energy performance, include all such options inside parentheses within the larger model/product number.
Example: Product family X uses product numbers that contain eight alphanumeric characters. The first three characters denote product variations that affect energy performance; a subset of options denoted by the fourth character do not affect performance; and the last four characters do not affect energy performance at all. The manufacturer/brand owner would submit a separate “Add Product” form for each unique combination of the first four characters that affect energy performance; on each form, the submitted model numbers would have the form: ABC(1,2,3)****, ABC4****, ABC5****, etc.

term.name: Universal Product Code
term.description: If provided, the user must submit all 12 digits without spaces or dashes.

term.name: ENERGY STAR Label
term.description: Indicate whether the product has earned the ENERGY STAR label.

term.name: ENERGY STAR Version Number
term.description: List the version number of the most current ENERGY STAR specification under which the product earned the ENERGY STAR label.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Values should include a tenths place digit (e.g., "4.0", or "5.1").

term.name: FEMP Designated Product
term.description: Indicate whether the product currently meets the energy performance requirements necessary to be identified as a Federal Energy Management Program-designated product.

term.name: Lamp Distribution Type
term.description: A general description of distribution type, such as "omnidirectional." "Directional" lamp examples include R-lamps and PAR-lamps. "Linear" lamp examples include T8 and T5 lamps.

term.name: ANSI Lamp Designation
term.description: The first letter symbol (shape classification) and the first number symbol (reference dimension) from the lamp designation format in ANSI standard C79.1-2002. Exclude hyphens (e.g., enter "T8" rather than "T-8"). For lamps with a reference diameter in IP units, no additional characters should be entered. For lamps with a reference diameter in SI units, add a space and "(SI)" after the reference number (e.g., "PAR121 (SI)"). For rectangular lamps, SI units are customary; separate the two millimeter dimensions with an "x", and do not add "(SI)" (e.g., "REC142x200").
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: (1) Autocomplete allows either values from an enumeration list (of common choices) or other values typed by the user. (2) [If the user entry contains a lowercase "x" OR an uppercase "SI"] AND [if the user has selected "IP" for the units on this page], THEN return an error.

term.name: Number of Lamps
term.description: The number of lamps driven by the ballast.

term.name: Input Power at 120V
term.description: The ballast input power required to drive a specific lamp or lamps at 120V. (If this ballast is not designed for 120V operation, leave this field blank.)

term.name: Input Power at 277V
term.description: The ballast input power required to drive a specific lamp or lamps at 277V. (If this ballast is not designed for 277V operation, leave this field blank.)

term.name: Ballast Factor
term.description: "The fractional flux of a fluorescent lamp operated on a ballast compared to the flux when operated on the standard (reference) ballast specificed for rating lamp lumens." (IESNA Lighting Ready Reference, 4th ed., 2003.)

term.name: Input Voltage
term.description: The ballast input voltage or voltages. List multiple voltages only if a single model number is used for a product that can be operated at multiple voltages.

term.name: Input Power Factor at 120V
term.description: The ratio of active power (watts) to apparent power (volt-amperes) when operated at 120V. (If this ballast is not designed for 120V operation, leave this field blank.) According to ANSI Standard C82.13: "The active power is to be measured with a wattmeter capable of indicating the average power in watts. The apparent power is to be the products of the true rms values of the input voltage and current."

term.name: Input Power Factor at 277V
term.description: The ratio of active power (watts) to apparent power (volt-amperes) when operated at 277V. (If this ballast is not designed for 277V operation, leave this field blank.) According to ANSI Standard C82.13: "The active power is to be measured with a wattmeter capable of indicating the average power in watts. The apparent power is to be the products of the true rms values of the input voltage and current."

term.name: Total Harmonic Distortion
term.description: The ratio of the root mean squared "values of the harmonic content to that of the fundamental current, expresseed as a percentage." (ANSI C82.13)
term.tp_third_party_testing: ANSI C82.6 (HID). ANSI C82.2 is the comparable standard for fluorescent, but C82.2-2002 doesn't discuss THD.

term.name: Ballast Type
term.description: Ballast type, including characteristics such as the light source type, whether the ballast is magnetic or electronic, and whether the ballast is designed for dimming.

term.name: Starting Method
term.description: The type of starting method, such as "instant start."

term.name: Specification Sheet
term.description: A document that provides additional product performance-related information. Such documents may contain energy performance data, wiring diagrams, dimensions, or other technical details about the product. This information must be formatted as a PDF file.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Needs to be formatted as a PDF.

level_2.name: Lamps
level_2.description: The Lamp subgroup encompasses traditional lamp products (fluorescent lamps, high-intensity discharge lamps, etc.), and SSL products that are intended to replace conventional lamps in existing luminaires.

level_3.name: Non-SSL Lamps
level_3.description: Products included in this technology category include all types of electric lamps, other than those that make use of solid-state lighting technologies. Lamp products included in this technology category are intended to be housed in a fixture and encompass many different lighting technologies including, but not limited to, filament, fluorescent, high-intensity discharge, and high- and low-pressure sodium lamps.

term.name: ENERGY STAR Version Number
term.description: List the version number of the most current ENERGY STAR specification under which the product earned the ENERGY STAR label.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Values should include a tenths place digit (e.g., "4.0", or "5.1").

term.name: FEMP Designated Product
term.description: Indicate whether the product currently meets the energy performance requirements necessary to be identified as a Federal Energy Management Program-designated product.

term.name: Initial Luminous Flux
term.description: Luminous flux at the beginning of product life, where luminous flux is "the time rate of flow of radiant energy, evaluated in terms of standardized visual response." (Adapted from IESNA Lighting Ready Reference, 4th ed., 2003.)

term.name: Standard Photometric Data
term.description: For directional lamps, provide standard photometric electronic data in accordance with IES LM-63; the format is commonly called an *.ies file. For non-directional lamps, this field should be left blank.

term.name: Input Power
term.description: Power consumed by the lamp during steady-state operation in the "on" mode.

term.name: Lamp Distribution Type
term.description: A general description of distribution type, such as "omnidirectional." "Directional" lamp examples include R-lamps and PAR-lamps. "Linear" lamp examples include T8 and T5 lamps.

term.name: ANSI Lamp Designation
term.description: The first letter symbol (shape classification) and the first number symbol (reference dimension) from the lamp designation format in ANSI standard C79.1-2002. Exclude hyphens (e.g., enter "T8" rather than "T-8"). For lamps with a reference diameter in IP units, no additional characters should be entered. For lamps with a reference diameter in SI units, add a space and "(SI)" after the reference number (e.g., "PAR121 (SI)"). For rectangular lamps, SI units are customary; separate the two millimeter dimensions with an "x", and do not add "(SI)" (e.g., "REC142x200").
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: (1) Autocomplete allows either values from an enumeration list (of common choices) or other values typed by the user. (2) [If the user entry contains a lowercase "x" OR an uppercase "SI"] AND [if the user has selected "IP" for the units on this page], THEN return an error.

term.name: Correlated Color Temperature
term.description: "The absolute temperature of a blackbody whose chromacity most nearly matches that of the light source." (IESNA Lighting Ready Reference, 4th ed., 2003.)

term.name: Specification Sheet
term.description: A document that provides additional product performance-related information. Such documents may contain energy performance data, wiring diagrams, dimensions, photometric data, or other technical details about the product. This information must be formatted as a PDF file.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Needs to be formatted as a PDF.

term.name: Mean Luminous Flux
term.description: The average value of "the time rate of flow of radiant energy, evaluated in terms of standardized visual response." (Adapted from IESNA Lighting Ready Reference, 4th ed., 2003.)
term.tp_additional_data_submitter_info: Enter a value here if the product's mean luminous flux does not depend on orientation of the installation. This is true for most lamps besides metal halide lamps.

term.name: Mean Luminous Flux for Horizontal Installations
term.description: The average value of "the time rate of flow of radiant energy, evaluated in terms of standardized visual response." (Adapted from IESNA Lighting Ready Reference, 4th ed., 2003.) For metal halide lamps, "horizontal" here refers to the orientation of the arc tube.
term.tp_additional_data_submitter_info: Enter a value here if the product's mean luminous flux depends on whether the installation is horizontal or vertical. This is more common with metal halide lamps than with other lamps.

term.name: Mean Luminous Flux for Vertical Installations
term.description: The average value of "the time rate of flow of radiant energy, evaluated in terms of standardized visual response." (Adapted from IESNA Lighting Ready Reference, 4th ed., 2003.) For metal halide lamps, "vertical" here refers to the orientation of the arc tube.
term.tp_additional_data_submitter_info: Enter a value here if the product's mean luminous flux depends on whether the installation is horizontal or vertical. This is more common with metal halide lamps than with other lamps.

term.name: Color Rendering Index
term.description: "A measure of the degree of color shift objects undergo when illuminated by the light source as compared with those same objects when illuminated by a reference source of comparable color temperature." (IESNA Lighting Ready Reference, 4th ed., 2003.)

term.name: Rated Life
term.description: The rated life of the lamp in hours.

term.name: Light Source Type
term.description: The type of illumination technology, such as "compact fluorescent."

term.name: Integral Ballast
term.description: Indicate whether the lamp is packaged with an integral ballast.

level_3.name: SSL Replacement Lamps
level_3.description: The scope of this technology category is limited to solid-state lighting lamps that are intended to replace traditional light sources in existing luminaires. Solid-state lighting replacement lamp products listed here may include decorative, directional, linear, and omnidirectional sources.

term.name: Lumen Maintenance
term.description: The elapsed operating time over which the LED light source will maintain 70% of its initial light output. (Adapted from IES LM-80-08, definition 3.6.)

level_2.name: Luminaires
level_2.description: The Luminaire subgroup includes traditional luminaire products as well as SSL source/driver packages.

level_3.name: Non-SSL Luminaires
level_3.description: Luminaire products that are measured with standard lamps using relative photometry are included within the scope of this technology category. Examples of "Non-SSL Luminaires" are luminaires that house filament, fluorescent, or high-intensity discharge lamps. This category excludes solid-state lighting luminaires, which involve the use of different testing methods to determine performance.

term.name: Reference Input Power
term.description: Luminaire input power based on a standardized test configuration. For many Non-SSL Luminaire applications, lamps and ballasts are sold separately, and different combinations can have different power requirements. The Reference Input Power is only representative of one lamp-ballast combination.

term.name: Reference Input Voltage
term.description: The luminaire input voltage used when measuring the reference input power.

term.name: Light Source Type
term.description: The type of illumination technology, such as "compact fluorescent."

term.name: Number of Lamps
term.description: The number of lamps in the luminaire.

term.name: ANSI Lamp Designation
term.description: The first letter symbol (shape classification) and the first number symbol (reference dimension) from the lamp designation format in ANSI standard C79.1-2002. Exclude hyphens (e.g., enter "T8" rather than "T-8"). For lamps with a reference diameter in IP units, no additional characters should be entered. level_3.name: SSL Luminaires
level_3.description: Products encompassed by this technology category include solid-state lighting luminaires that contain a solid-state lighting source (LED, OLED, or PLED) and driver in the same product package. This category excludes solid-state lighting replacement lamps, which are intended to replace non solid-state lighting lamps in existing non solid-state lighting fixtures.

term.name: Input Power
term.description: The luminaire input power.

term.name: Lumen Maintenance
term.description: The elapsed operating time over which the LED light source will maintain 70% of its initial light output. (Adapted from IES LM-80-08, definition 3.6.)

term.name: Total Luminous Flux
term.description: The total luminous flux emitted by the luminaire expressed in lumens.

term.name: Input Voltage
term.description: The luminaire input voltage or voltages at which the SSL Luminaire is designed to operate. List multiple voltages only if a single model number is associated with a product that can operate at multiple voltages.

term.name: Luminous Efficacy
term.description: The quotient of the luminaire's total emitted luminous flux by the total luminaire input power, expressed in lumens per watt. (Adapted from IESNA Lighting Ready Reference, 4th ed., 2003.)

term.name: Correlated Color Temperature
term.description: "The absolute temperature of a blackbody whose chromacity most nearly matches that of the light source." (IESNA Lighting Ready Reference, 4th ed., 2003.)

term.name: Color Rendering Index
term.description: "A measure of the degree of color shift objects undergo when illuminated by the light source as compared with those same objects when illuminated by a reference source of comparable color temperature." (IESNA Lighting Ready Reference, 4th ed., 2003.)

term.name: Input Power Factor
term.description: The ratio of active power (watts) to apparent power (volt-amperes). "The active power is to be measured with a wattmeter capable of indicating the average power in watts. The apparent power is to be the products of the true rms values of the input voltage and current." (ANSI C82.13)

term.name: Total Harmonic Distortion
term.description: The ratio of the root mean squared "values of the harmonic content to that of the fundamental current, expresseed as a percentage." (ANSI C82.13)
term.tp_third_party_testing: ANSI C82.6 (HID). ANSI C82.2 is the comparable standard for fluorescent, but C82.2-2002 doesn't discuss THD.

level_1.name: HVAC
level_1.description: Technology categories contained in the Heating, Ventilation, and Air-Conditioning Group pertain to products used to provide thermal control to a space or working fluid, or those products that support the delivery of such fluids; and whose primary purpose is to support process thermal load requirements, ensure occupant comfort, or maintain acceptable indoor air quality.

level_2.name: Hydronic Cooling Equipment
level_2.description: The Hydronic Cooling Equipment subgroup includes HVAC products whose primary function is to remove energy from water for space conditioning or process cooling applications.

level_3.name: Electrically-Driven Mechanical-Compression Chillers
level_3.description: Products included within this technology category include electrically driven chillers that use positive displacement or dynamic compressors (scroll, screw, centrifugal, or reciprocating) as part of a refrigerant loop to transfer heat from an evaporator to a condenser (air, evaporative, or water-cooled). For chillers that utilize a water-cooled condenser, any equipment used to condition condenser water (e.g., a cooling tower) is outside the scope of this technology category. Absorption, adsorption, turbine-driven, and engine-driven products are not covered here.

term.name: OpenStudio Type
term.description: Type of OpenStudio Object

term.name: Manufacturer/Brand Owner
term.description: The name of the company that manufactures the product and/or that owns the product brand.

term.name: Brand
term.description: The brand name under which the submitted product is marketed and/or sold in the U.S. In some cases, this may be identical to the name of the manufacturer/brand owner.

term.name: Product Line/Family Name
term.description: If the product being submitted is part of a family of products or models, supply the product line or family name here. As an example, if the submission were an automobile, this field would contain the model name.

term.name: Model Number
term.description:
The unique model number used by the manufacturer/brand owner to identify the specific product being submitted to the Technology Performance Exchange. Sometimes referred to as “catalog number.”
Model numbers should be entered in the same style as that used by the manufacturer/brand owner, including all applicable slashes (/) and dashes (-). If certain alphanumeric characters in the model number identify product variations that do not impact energy performance, please replace each of those alphanumeric characters with an asterisk (*) when entering the model number on this website. This convention reduces the need to submit separate forms for product variations that have identical performance data. However, if a subset, but not all options for a specific character in the model number do not affect energy performance, include all such options inside parentheses within the larger model/product number.
Example: Product family X uses product numbers that contain eight alphanumeric characters. The first three characters denote product variations that affect energy performance; a subset of options denoted by the fourth character do not affect performance; and the last four characters do not affect energy performance at all. The manufacturer/brand owner would submit a separate “Add Product” form for each unique combination of the first four characters that affect energy performance; on each form, the submitted model numbers would have the form: ABC(1,2,3)****, ABC4****, ABC5****, etc.

term.name: Universal Product Code
term.description: If provided, the user must submit all 12 digits without spaces or dashes.

term.name: ENERGY STAR Label
term.description: Indicate whether the product has earned the ENERGY STAR label.

term.name: ENERGY STAR Version Number
term.description: List the version number of the most current ENERGY STAR specification under which the product earned the ENERGY STAR label.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Values should include a tenths place digit (e.g., "4.0", or "5.1").

term.name: FEMP Designated Product
term.description: Indicate whether the product currently meets the energy performance requirements necessary to be identified as a Federal Energy Management Program-designated product.

term.name: AHRI Certified Reference Number
term.description: Provide this number if your product is certified under the AHRI Water Chilling Packages (Air Cooled) or the Water Chilling Packages Using Vapor Compression Cycle (Water-Cooled) certification program.

term.name: Net Refrigeration Capacity
term.description: "The capacity of the evaporator available for cooling of the thermal load external to the Water-Chilling Package and is calculated using only the sensible heat transfer." (AHRI 550/590)

term.name: AHRI Rated Coefficient of Performance
term.description: "A ratio of the Net Refrigerating Capacity in watts to the power input values in watts at any given set of Rating Conditions expressed in watts/watt." (AHRI 550/590)

term.name: Compressor Type
term.description: The type of compressor technology used by the chiller.

term.name: Compressor Motor Type
term.description: The relationship between the gas being compressed and the motor driving the compressor.

term.name: Compressor Motor Efficiency
term.description: The efficiency of the motor used to drive the compressor, at full-speed operation.

term.name: Minimum Part Load Ratio
term.description: The minimum part load ratio of the chiller.

term.name: Part Load Ratio Below Which Hot Gas Bypass Operates
term.description: The part load ratio of the chiller below which hot gas bypass (HGBP) operates.

term.name: Maximum Part Load Ratio
term.description: The maximum part load ratio that the chiller is able to operate at.

term.name: Variable-Speed Drive Compressor
term.description: Is the compressor capable of variable-speed operation?

term.name: Refrigerant
term.description: Select the type of refrigerant.

term.name: Condenser Type
term.description: Select the method used to cool the refrigerant-side condenser.

term.name: Minimum Condenser Water Flow Rate
term.description: The minimum flow rate of water required through the refrigerant-side condenser while the chiller is operating.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Condenser Type" is "Water-cooled"

term.name: Maximum Condenser Water Flow Rate
term.description: The maximum flow rate of water that can pass through the refrigerant-side condenser.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Condenser Type" is "Water-cooled"

term.name: Design Condenser Water Flow Rate
term.description: The manufacturer-recommended flow rate of water through the refrigerant-side condenser.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Condenser Type" is "Water-cooled"

term.name: Minimum Condenser Water Supply Temperature
term.description: The minimum entering water temperature allowed to the refrigerant-side condenser.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Condenser Type" is "Water-cooled"

term.name: Maximum Condenser Water Supply Temperature
term.description: The maximum entering water temperature allowed to the refrigerant-side condenser.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Condenser Type" is "Water-cooled"

term.name: Condenser Pressure Drop
term.description: The water pressure drop through the refrigerant-side condenser when the flow rate through the condenser is equal to the manufacturer’s recommended value.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Condenser Type" is "Water-cooled"

term.name: Minimum Outdoor Air Dry Bulb Temperature
term.description: The dry-bulb temperature below which the condenser is prevented from operating.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Condenser Type" is "Air-cooled"

term.name: Maximum Outdoor Air Dry Bulb Temperature
term.description: The dry-bulb temperature above which the condenser is prevented from operating.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Condenser Type" is "Air-cooled"

term.name: Fan Control
term.description: The type of fan control used to cool the condenser.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Condenser Type" is "Air-cooled"

term.name: Minimum Outdoor Air Wet Bulb Temperature
term.description: The wet-bulb temperature below which the condenser is prevented from operating.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Condenser Type" is "Evaporatively-cooled"

term.name: Maximum Outdoor Air Wet Bulb Temperature
term.description: The wet-bulb temperature above which the condenser is prevented from operating.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Condenser Type" is "Evaporatively-cooled"

term.name: Basin Heater Capacity
term.description: The rated capacity of the basin heater (used for freeze protection with evaporatively-cooled condensers).
term.ip_written: Thousand British Thermal Units per Hour
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Condenser Type" is "Evaporatively-cooled"

term.name: Minimum Chilled Water Flow Rate
term.description: The minimum chilled water flow rate that the chiller is designed to supply.

term.name: Maximum Chilled Water Flow Rate
term.description: The maximum chilled water flow rate that the chiller is designed to supply.

term.name: Design Chilled Water Flow Rate
term.description: The chilled water flow rate that the chiller is designed to supply.

term.name: Minimum Chilled Water Supply Temperature
term.description: The minimum chilled water temperature that the chiller is designed to supply.

term.name: Maximum Chilled Water Supply Temperature
term.description: The maximum chilled water temperature that the chiller is designed to supply.

term.name: Design Chilled Water Supply Temperature
term.description: The chilled water temperature that the chiller is designed to supply.

term.name: Evaporator Pressure Drop
term.description: The chilled water pressure drop across the evaporator at the chilled water supply design flow rate.

term.name: Performance Map
term.description: A document detailing the chiller's performance under various conditions. The information must be formatted in alignment with the provided template, and uploaded as a .xls.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Append a distinct number on the end of the performance map name if duplicate names are uploaded (e.g., "Brand Model#_1.xls". This may happen if two sets of data are uploaded for the same product. Remove any special characters that may appear in the file name.
term.tp_additional_data_user_info: The performance map provides performance characterisitics under various operating conditions to enable a detailed analysis.
term.tp_additional_data_submitter_info: The name of the xls file should be entered as "Brand Model#.xls".

term.name: Chiller Control Documentation
term.description: A document describing the unit’s typical sequence of operation (SOO) and/or other control-related information. The document must be formatted as a PDF.

term.name: Product Data Sheet
term.description: A document that provides additional product performance-related information. Such documents may contain energy performance data, mounting diagrams, dimensions, a description of factory options/accessories, or other technical details about the product. This information must be formatted as a PDF.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Needs to be formatted as a PDF.

level_2.name: Hydronic Heating Equipment
level_2.description: The Hydronic Heating Equipment subgroup includes HVAC products whose primary function is to transfer energy to water or steam for space conditioning or process heating applications.

level_3.name: Boilers
level_3.description: Products encompassed by this technology category include fossil-fuel fired, electric, and biomass water and steam boilers. Biomass dryers are not covered here.

term.name: OpenStudio Type
term.description: Type of OpenStudio Object

term.name: Manufacturer/Brand Owner
term.description: The name of the company that manufactures the product and/or that owns the product brand.

term.name: Brand
term.description: The brand name under which the submitted product is marketed and/or sold in the U.S. In some cases, this may be identical to the name of the manufacturer/brand owner.

term.name: Product Line/Family Name
term.description: If the product being submitted is part of a family of products or models, supply the product line or family name here. As an example, if the submission were an automobile, this field would contain the model name.

term.name: Model Number
term.description:
The unique model number used by the manufacturer/brand owner to identify the specific product being submitted to the Technology Performance Exchange. Sometimes referred to as “catalog number.”
Model numbers should be entered in the same style as that used by the manufacturer/brand owner, including all applicable slashes (/) and dashes (-). If certain alphanumeric characters in the model number identify product variations that do not impact energy performance, please replace each of those alphanumeric characters with an asterisk (*) when entering the model number on this website. This convention reduces the need to submit separate forms for product variations that have identical performance data. However, if a subset, but not all options for a specific character in the model number do not affect energy performance, include all such options inside parentheses within the larger model/product number.
Example: Product family X uses product numbers that contain eight alphanumeric characters. The first three characters denote product variations that affect energy performance; a subset of options denoted by the fourth character do not affect performance; and the last four characters do not affect energy performance at all. The manufacturer/brand owner would submit a separate “Add Product” form for each unique combination of the first four characters that affect energy performance; on each form, the submitted model numbers would have the form: ABC(1,2,3)****, ABC4****, ABC5****, etc.

term.name: Universal Product Code
term.description: If provided, the user must submit all 12 digits without spaces or dashes.

term.name: ENERGY STAR Label
term.description: Indicate whether the product has earned the ENERGY STAR label.

term.name: ENERGY STAR Version Number
term.description: List the version number of the most current ENERGY STAR specification under which the product earned the ENERGY STAR label.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Values should include a tenths place digit (e.g., "4.0", or "5.1").

term.name: FEMP Designated Product
term.description: Indicate whether the product currently meets the energy performance requirements necessary to be identified as a Federal Energy Management Program-designated product.

term.name: AHRI Certified Reference Number
term.description: Provide this number if your product is certified under the AHRI Commercial Boiler or Residential Boiler certification program.

term.name: Input Power
term.description: The rate of energy consumption of the boiler at full load.
term.ip_written: Thousand British Thermal Units per Hour

term.name: Annual Fuel Utilization Efficiency
term.description: The efficiency of an appliance in converting fuel to heat over a typical year.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Input Power" is less than "300,000"
term.tp_additional_data_submitter_info: Only applicable to boilers with inputs less than 300,000 BTU/hr

term.name: Combustion Efficiency
term.description: "100% less the losses due to (1) Dry Flue Gas, (2) Incomplete Combustion, and (3) Moisture Formed by Combustion of Hydrogen." (AHRI-HI BTS-2000)

term.name: Thermal Efficiency
term.description: "The ratio of the heat absorbed by the water or the water and steam to the higher heating value in the fuel burned." (AHRI-HI BTS-2000)

term.name: Heating Medium
term.description: The substance used to transfer heat from the boiler to the space or process equipment.

term.name: Minimum Flow Rate
term.description: The minimum flow rate of water required while the boiler is firing.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Heating Medium" is "Water"

term.name: Maximum Flow Rate
term.description: The maximum flow rate of water that can pass through the boiler.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Heating Medium" is "Water"

term.name: Flow Rate at 20°F Temperature Rise
term.description: The flow rate of water through the boiler at 100% firing rate and a 20°F temperature rise.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Heating Medium" is "Water"

term.name: Minimum Feedwater Temperature
term.description: The minimum feedwater temperature recommended by the manufacturer.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Heating Medium" is "Water"

term.name: Condensing Operation
term.description: Is the boiler capable of condensing the water vapor in the exhaust flue gas to obtain a higher efficiency?
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Heating Medium" is "Water"
term.tp_additional_data_user_info: Select "No" if the boiler is an electric boiler

term.name: Minimum Operating Pressure
term.description: The minimum amount of steam pressure required during boiler operation. This should be input as gauge pressure.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Heating Medium" is "Steam"

term.name: Maximum Operating Pressure
term.description: The maximum amount of steam pressure allowed during boiler operation. This should be input as gauge pressure.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Heating Medium" is "Steam"

term.name: Fuel Type
term.description: The fuel or fuels that the boiler can operate on.

term.name: Nominal Voltage
term.description: The voltage that the boiler operates on.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input appears if "Electric" is selected as an option in "Fuel Type"

term.name: Maximum Fuel Moisture Content
term.description: The maximum permissible weight basis moisture of the fuel, as specified by the manufacturer.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input appears if "Anthracite Coal," "Bituminous Coal," "Subbituminous Coal," "Lignite Coal," "Wood Pellets," "Hog Fuel," "Wood Residue," or "Agricultural Residues" are selected as an option in "Fuel Type"

term.name: Fuel Moisture Content as Tested
term.description: The total weight basis moisture of the fuel, as tested.
term.tp_third_party_testing: ASTM E871 - 82(2006) Standard Test Method for Moisture Analysis of Particulate Wood Fuels
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input appears if "Anthracite Coal," "Bituminous Coal," "Subbituminous Coal," "Lignite Coal," "Wood Pellets," "Hog Fuel," "Wood Residue," or "Agricultural Residues" are selected as an option in "Fuel Type"

term.name: Fuel Calorific Value as Tested
term.description: Analagous to higher heating value. Enter the Gross Calorific Value of the fuel, as tested.
term.tp_third_party_testing: ASTM E870 - 82(2006) Standard Test Methods for Analysis of Wood Fuels
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input appears if "Anthracite Coal," "Bituminous Coal," "Subbituminous Coal," "Lignite Coal," "Wood Pellets," "Hog Fuel," "Wood Residue," or "Agricultural Residues" are selected as an option in "Fuel Type"

term.name: Water Cooled Grate
term.description: Does the boiler have a water-cooled grate to control combustion airflow?
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input appears if "Anthracite Coal," "Bituminous Coal," "Subbituminous Coal," "Lignite Coal," "Wood Pellets," "Hog Fuel," "Wood Residue," or "Agricultural Residues" are selected as an option in "Fuel Type"

term.name: PPM NOx Emissions
term.description: The concentration of NOX in the exhaust gas, reported as the volume of NOX divided by the volume of air. NOX is the sum of nitric oxide (NO) and nitrogen dioxide (NO2). Boiler should be at 100% firing rate during sampling.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input appears UNLESS "Electric" is chosen as an option in "Fuel Type." If multiple options are selected in "Fuel Type" allow multiple "PPM NOx Emissions" values, with the fuel type automatically appended (e.g., "PPM NOx Emissions Propane")

term.name: Draft Type
term.description: The method of creating a pressure difference that causes air to flow through the boiler.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input appears UNLESS "Electric" is chosen as an option in "Fuel Type."

term.name: Ignition Type
term.description: The method of fuel ignition.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input appears UNLESS "Electric" is chosen as an option in "Fuel Type."

term.name: Heat Exchanger Material
term.description: The heat exchanger material.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input appears UNLESS "Electric" is chosen as an option in "Fuel Type."

term.name: Input Power Control
term.description: Select the appropriate control of input power. Select "single stage" for units with single stage (on/off) control. Select "multiple, discrete stages" for units with multiple discrete stages (low-fire / high-fire). Select "modulating" for units capable of modulating the firing rate.

term.name: Number of Discrete Heating Stages
term.description: Enter the number of heating stages, excluding off.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Input Power Control" is "Multiple, Discrete Stages"

term.name: Turndown Ratio
term.description: The ratio of full capacity to the lowest possible firing rate (n:1).
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Input Power Control" is "Multiple, Discrete Stages" or "Modulating"

term.name: Location
term.description: A description of the locations in which the boiler can be installed.

term.name: Standby Heat Loss
term.description: The power input required to maintain 160°F water temperature for water boilers, or 212°F for steam boilers, at a room temperature of 80°F with a supply flow rate of zero.
term.ip_written: Thousand British Thermal Units per Hour

term.name: Additional Emissions Equipment
term.description: Is additional emissions reduction equipment/options available for this model?
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input appears UNLESS "Electric" is chosen as an option in "Fuel Type."

term.name: Description of Additional Emissions Equipment
term.description: A document describing the emissions reduction equipment that can be added to the boiler. The document must be formatted as a PDF.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Additional Emissions Equipment" is "Yes"

term.name: Control Options
term.description: A description of the factory-installed controls, which may include boiler sequencing, cascading, balancing, outdoor air resets, and/or requirements for integration with building automation systems. The document must be formatted as a PDF.

term.name: Boiler Performance Map
term.description: A document detailing the boiler's heating performance under various operating conditions. The information must be formatted in alignment with the provided template, and uploaded as a .xls.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Append a distinct number on the end of the performance map name if duplicate names are uploaded (e.g., "Brand Model# Fuel Type_1.xls". This may happen if two sets of data are uploaded for the same boiler. Remove any special characters that may appear in the file name.
term.tp_additional_data_user_info: The performance map provides performance characterisitics under various operating conditions to enable a detailed analysis.
term.tp_additional_data_submitter_info: The name of the xls file should be entered as "Brand Model# FuelType.xls".

term.name: Product Data Sheet
term.description: A document that provides additional product performance-related information. Such documents may contain energy performance data, mounting diagrams, dimensions, a description of factory options/accessories, or other technical details about the product. This information must be formatted as a PDF file.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Needs to be formatted as a PDF.

level_2.name: Packaged Unitary Equipment
level_2.description: This subgroup includes HVAC products that are (1) contained within a single housing; and (2) whose primary function typically involves the conditioning of an airstream via a set of integrated heating and/or cooling coils.

level_3.name: Rooftop Units
level_3.description: Products covered within this technology category include vapor-compression driven unitary cooling equipment (both with and without heating capabilities) and vapor-compression driven unitary air-source heat pumps. Units containing stepped- or variable-speed compressors or fans are included in this technology category. However, units employing the use of desiccant wheels, direct or indirect evaporative technologies, split systems, and heating-only systems are not covered by this technology category.

term.name: OpenStudio Type
term.description: Type of OpenStudio Object

term.name: Manufacturer/Brand Owner
term.description: The name of the company that manufactures the product and/or that owns the product brand.

term.name: Brand
term.description: The brand name under which the submitted product is marketed and/or sold in the U.S. In some cases, this may be identical to the name of the manufacturer/brand owner.

term.name: Product Line/Family Name
term.description: If the product being submitted is part of a family of products or models, supply the product line or family name here. As an example, if the submission were an automobile, this field would contain the model name.

term.description:
The unique model number used by the manufacturer/brand owner to identify the specific product being submitted to the Technology Performance Exchange. Sometimes referred to as “catalog number.”

The manufacturer/brand owner would submit a separate “Add Product” form for each unique combination of the first four characters that affect energy performance; on each form, the submitted model numbers would have the form: ABC(1,2,3)****, ABC4****, ABC5****, etc.

term.name: Universal Product Code
term.description: If provided, the user must submit all 12 digits without spaces or dashes.

term.name: ENERGY STAR Label
term.description: Indicate whether the product has earned the ENERGY STAR label.

term.name: ENERGY STAR Version Number
term.description: List the version number of the most current ENERGY STAR specification under which the product earned the ENERGY STAR label.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Values should include a tenths place digit (e.g., "4.0", or "5.1").

term.name: FEMP Designated Product
term.description: Indicate whether the product currently meets the energy performance requirements necessary to be identified as a Federal Energy Management Program-designated product.

term.name: AHRI Certified Reference Number
term.description: Provide this number if your product is certified under the AHRI Unitary Large Equipment, Unitary Air Conditioner Equipment, or Unitary Heat Pump Equipment certification program.

term.name: Nominal Cooling Capacity
term.description: The nominal cooling capacity.

term.name: Energy Efficiency Ratio
term.description: "A ratio of the Cooling Capacity in Btu/h to the power input values in watts at any given set of rating conditions expressed in Btu/W·h." (AHRI 340/360 2007)
term.ip_written: British Thermal Units per hour per Watt
term.si_written: British Thermal Units per hour per Watt

term.name: Integrated Energy Efficiency Ratio
term.description: "A single number cooling part-load efficiency figure of merit." (AHRI 340/360 2007)
term.ip_written: British Thermal Units per hour per Watt
term.si_written: British Thermal Units per hour per Watt

term.name: Seasonal Energy Efficiency Ratio
term.description: "The total heat removed from the conditioned space during the annual cooling season, expressed in Btu’s, divided by the total electrical energy consumed by the air conditioner or heat pump during the same season, expressed in watt-hours." (AHRI 210/240 2008)
term.ip_written: British Thermal Units per hour per Watt
term.si_written: British Thermal Units per hour per Watt

term.name: Cooling Mode: Indoor Fan Speed Control
term.description: Select the type of indoor fan speed control for the unit, when it is in cooling mode. Select "constant speed" for units that operate at a single, constant speed. Select "stepped speed" for units that operate at multiple discrete steps. Select "variable speed" for variable speed control.

term.name: Cooling Mode: Number of Discrete Fan Speeds
term.description: Enter the number of discrete operating speeds for the indoor fan motor when the unit is in cooling mode. (Excluding 'off'.)
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This line is only shown if the answer to "Cooling Mode: Indoor Fan Speed Control" is "Stepped Speed"

term.name: Cooling Mode: Minimum Fan Speed as a Fraction of Maximum
term.description: Divide the minimum fan RPM (when in cooling mode) by the maximum fan RPM (when in cooling mode).
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This line is only shown if the answer to "Cooling Mode: Indoor Fan Speed Control" is "Stepped Speed" or "Variable Speed"

term.name: Heating Mode: Indoor Fan Speed Control
term.description: Select the type of indoor fan speed control for the unit, when it is in heating mode. Select "constant speed" for units that operate at a single, constant speed. Select "stepped speed" for units that operate at multiple discrete steps. Select "variable speed" for variable speed control.

term.name: Heating Mode: Number of Discrete Fan Speeds
term.description: Enter the number of discrete operating speeds for the indoor fan motor when the unit is in heating mode. (Excluding 'off'.)
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This line is only shown if the answer to "Heating Mode: Indoor Fan Speed Control" is "Stepped Speed"

term.name: Heating Mode: Minimum Fan Speed as a Fraction of Maximum
term.description: Divide the minimum fan RPM (when in heating mode) by the maximum fan RPM (when in heating mode).
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This line is only shown if the answer to "Heating Mode: Indoor Fan Speed Control" is "Stepped Speed" or "Variable Speed"

term.name: Internal Static Pressure at Full Speed
term.description: Internal static pressure of the unit at full indoor fan speed including all filters, coils and accessories used in this model.

term.name: Compressor Staging
term.description: Select the type of compressor staging for the unit. Select "single stage" for units with single stage (on/off) control. Select "multiple, discrete stages" for units with multiple compressors, discrete unloading stages, or compressors with stepped speed motors that are controlled to operate at discrete stages. Select "variable" for compressors that operate at variable speeds or with modulating unloading.

term.name: Number of Discrete Cooling Stages
term.description: Enter the number of discrete operating stages for the compressors. (Excluding 'off'.)
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This line is only shown if the answer to "Compressor Staging" is "Multiple, discrete stages"

term.name: Degradation Coefficient
term.description: "Degradation Coefficient (CD). The measure of the efficiency loss due to the cycling of the units as determined in Appendices C and D [of the standard]." (AHRI 210/240 2008)

term.name: Refrigerant
term.description: Select the type of refrigerant.

term.name: Active Dehumidification
term.description: Select "Yes" if the unit contains an active dehumidification system (in addition to the dehumidification that takes place during normal DX cooling operation).

term.name: Evaporatively Cooled Condenser
term.description: Select “Yes” if the unit uses evaporative cooling to enhance heat rejection from the condenser coils.

term.name: Minimum Outdoor Dry Bulb for Cooling Operation
term.description: This is the minimum outdoor dry-bulb temperature at which the DX cooling coils will be able to operate.

term.name: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb for Cooling Operation
term.description: This is the maximum outdoor dry-bulb temperature at which the DX cooling coils will be able to operate.

term.name: Condenser Fan Speed Operation
term.description: Select the condenser fan control option for the unit. If the unit has several, constant-speed condenser fans that stage on in conjunction with multiple compressors, select “stepped speed.”

term.name: Air-Source Heat Pump
term.description: Select "yes" if this unit is a "Commercial and Industrial Unitary Heat Pump. One or more factory-made assemblies, which normally include an indoor conditioning coil, an air moving device, compressor(s), and an outdoor coil(s), including means to provide a heating Function and may or may not include a cooling Function." (AHRI 340/360 2007)

term.name: Minimum Outdoor Dry Bulb for Heat Pump Operation
term.description: This is the minimum outdoor dry-bulb temperature at which the DX coils will be able to operate during heat pump operation.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Air-Source Heat Pump" is "Yes"

term.name: Maximum Outdoor Dry Bulb for Heat Pump Operation
term.description: This is the maximum outdoor dry-bulb temperature at which the DX coils will be able to operate during heat pump operation.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Air-Source Heat Pump" is "Yes"

term.name: Type of Heating
term.description: Select the type of heating that the unit uses. This is independent of heat pump operation. If your unit is an air-source heat pump without supplemental heating, or has no heating coil/furnace section, select “none.”

term.name: Heating Staging
term.description: Select the type of heat staging for the unit. Select “single stage” for units with single stage (on/off) control. Select “multiple, discrete stages” for units with multiple discrete stages (low-fire / high-fire). Select “modulating” for modulating burners.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This input only appears if the answer to "Type of Heating" is "Gas" or "Electric"

term.name: Number of Heating Stages
term.description: Enter the number of heating stages, excluding off.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This line only appears if the answer to "Heating Staging" is "Multiple, discrete stages"

term.name: Turndown Ratio
term.description: Enter the turndown ratio for the burner. (Full input/minimum input)
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: This line only appears if the answer to "Heating Staging" is "Multiple, discrete stages" or "Modulating"

term.name: Economizer Control Types Available
term.description: Select all economizer options available for this model.

enumerations.enumeration: Fixed Dew Point and Dry Bulb

term.name: Performance Map
term.description: A document detailing the RTU's performance under various conditions. The information must be formatted in alignment with the provided template, and uploaded as a .xls.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Append a distinct number on the end of the performance map name if duplicate names are uploaded (e.g., "Brand Model#_1.xls". This may happen if two sets of data are uploaded for the same product. Remove any special characters that may appear in the file name.
term.tp_additional_data_user_info: The performance map provides performance characterisitics under various operating conditions to enable a detailed analysis.
term.tp_additional_data_submitter_info: The name of the xls file should be entered as "Brand Model#.xls".

term.name: RTU Control Documentation
term.description: A document describing the unit’s typical sequence of operation (SOO) and/or other control-related information. The document must be formatted as a PDF.

term.name: Product Data Sheet
term.description: A document that provides additional product performance-related information. Such documents may contain energy performance data, mounting diagrams, dimensions, a description of factory options/accessories, or other technical details about the product. This information must be formatted as a PDF file.
term.tp_additional_web_dev_info: Needs to be formatted as a PDF.

term.name: Peak Power
term.description: The peak power drawn by this piece of equipment. This may either be measured or nameplate rated.

term.name: Cycling Percent On
term.description: The percent of time that this piece of equipment is in the on state. Equipment is assumed to be in standby mode when not on.

term.name: Standby Power
term.description: The power drawn by this piece of equipment when not in the on state. This value is measured.

level_3.name: Photovoltaic Module
level_3.description: The total area of the module, including spaces between cells and the frame. Reference conditions are 1,000 W/m^2 insolation, 25°C.

term.name: OpenStudio Type
term.description: Type of OpenStudio Object

term.name: Area
term.description: The total area of the module, including spaces between cells and the frame. Reference conditions are 1,000 W/m^2 insolation, 25°C.

term.name: Cell Technology
term.description: A description of the semiconductor technology used in the photovoltaic cells. Reference conditions are 1,000 W/m^2 insolation, 25°C.

enumerations.enumeration: Amorphous Silicon Microcrystalline Silicon Tandem Module (a-Si/nc)

term.name: Maximum Power Current
term.description: Reference maximum power current at the reference conditions. Reference conditions are 1,000 W/m^2 insolation, 25°C.

term.name: Maximum Power Voltage
term.description: Reference maximum power voltage at the reference conditions. Reference conditions are 1,000 W/m^2 insolation, 25°C.

term.name: Maximum Power
term.description: The module rated power at reference conditions. Equal to the product of the maximum power voltage and maximum power current. Reference conditions are 1,000 W/m^2 insolation, 25°C.

term.name: Efficiency at Maximum Power
term.description: The module's rated efficiency at reference conditions. Reference conditions are 1,000 W/m^2 insolation, 25°C.

term.name: Open Circuit Voltage
term.description: Reference open circuit voltage at the reference conditions. Reference conditions are 1,000 W/m^2 insolation, 25°C.

term.name: Short Circuit Current
term.description: Reference short circuit current at the reference conditions. Reference conditions are 1,000 W/m^2 insolation, 25°C.

term.description: Weather station city or text identifier (sometimes this is more than city: "Zanesville municipal Ap" or "Climate Zone 9")

term.description: Latitude of the weather station

term.name: Longitude
term.description: Longitude of the weather station

term.name: Heating Degree Days base 18°C
term.description: Annual heating degree days. A heating degree day (HDD) is the number of degrees the daily average temperature lies below some base value (in this case 18°C). If the daily average temperature lies at or above the base temperature, the HDD for that day is zero. Annual Heating Degree Days is the sum of daily HDD over an entire year.

term.name: Cooling Degree Days base 18°C
term.description: Annual cooling degree days. A cooling degree day (CDD) is the number of degrees the daily average temperature lies above some base value (in this case 18°C). If the daily average temperature lies at or below the base temperature, the CDD for that day is zero. Annual Cooling Degree Days is the sum of daily CDD over an entire year.

term.name: Heating Degree Days base 10°C
term.description: Annual heating degree days. A heating degree day (HDD) is the number of degrees the daily average temperature lies below some base value (in this case 10°C). If the daily average temperature lies at or above the base temperature, the HDD for that day is zero. Annual Heating Degree Days is the sum of daily HDD over an entire year.

term.name: Cooling Degree Days base 10°C
term.description: Annual cooling degree days. A cooling degree day (CDD) is the number of degrees the daily average temperature lies above some base value (in this case 10°C). If the daily average temperature lies at or below the base temperature, the CDD for that day is zero. Annual Cooling Degree Days is the sum of daily CDD over an entire year.

term.name: Monthly mean db temperature
term.description: Average hourly dry bulb temperature per month over a year

term.name: Delta mean db temperature
term.description: Highest dry bulb temperature minus lowest dry bulb temperature recorded in a year

term.name: Standard Pressure at Elevation
term.description: Barometric pressure calculated at the weather station's elevation.
